alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 30 at 3:20PM MST until July 30 at 4:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 415 PM MST. * At 320 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Picacho to 6 miles southeast of Coolidge Airport to 10 miles southeast of Florence, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 180 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 162 and 178. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 124 and 151. Locations impacted include... Casa Grande, Florence, Coolidge, Queen Creek, Arizona City, La Palma, Blackwater, Toltec, Magma, San Tan Valley, Coolidge Airport, Arizola, San Tan Mountain Park, Randolph and Valley Farms. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
